FuncDef: The display mld group command displays multicast group information generated by using Source-Specific Multicast (SSM) mapping rules configured by using the ssm-mapping command.
CLIs: display mld group [ <GrpAddr6> | interface { <port-type> <port-num> | <port-name> } ] * [ ssm-mapping ] [ verbose ]
display mld { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | all-instance } group [ <GrpAddr6> | interface { <port-type> <port-num> | <port-name> } ] * [ ssm-mapping ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv6 multicast group address.
The value is in hexadecimal notation and in the format of FFxA:xxxx:xxxx::xxxx, in which x ranges from 0 to F and A is 0 or ranges from 3 to F.

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Displays multicast group information generated by using SSM mapping rules.
-

Displays detailed multicast group information generated by using SSM mapping rules.
-

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: Interface group report information of VPN-Instance: public net
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When running the display mld group command, note the following points:
If interface port-type port-number is specified, only multicast group information generated by using SSM mapping rules on a specified interface is displayed.If verbose is specified, various status parameters of multicast group information generated by using SSM mapping rules are displayed.
